mode_creation_workflow.overview: This workflow guides you through creating a new custom mode to be used in the Roo Code Software, from initial requirements gathering to final implementation.

step.title: Gather Requirements and Determine Scope
step.description: Understand what the user wants the mode to accomplish and whether it's a global or project-specific mode

actions.action: Determine if this is a global (system-wide) or project-specific mode
Ask about the mode's primary purpose and use cases
Identify what types of tasks the mode should handle
Determine what tools and file access the mode needs
Clarify any special behaviors or restrictions

global_mode.description: Global modes are system-wide and available across all projects

project_mode.description: Project-specific modes are only available in the current project

ask_followup_question.question: What is the primary purpose of this new mode? What types of tasks should it handle?

follow_up.suggest: A mode for writing and maintaining documentation
A mode for database schema design and migrations
A mode for API endpoint development and testing
A mode for performance optimization and profiling

step.title: Design Mode Configuration
step.description: Create the mode definition with all required fields

field.name: name
field.best_practice: Use an emoji that represents the mode's purpose

field.name: roleDefinition
field.description: Detailed description of the mode's role and expertise
field.best_practice: Start with "You are Roo Code, a [specialist type]..." List specific areas of expertise Mention key technologies or methodologies

field.name: groups
field.description: Tool groups the mode can access

options.option: File editing tools (can be restricted by regex)

field.name: whenToUse
field.best_practice: Explain specific scenarios and task types

step.important_note: Do not include customInstructions in the .roomodes configuration. All detailed instructions should be placed in XML files within the .roo/rules-[mode-slug]/ directory for project modes, or within the rules-[mode-slug]/ directory (repository root) for global modes.

example.comment: Restrict edit access to specific file types
example.code: groups: - read - - edit - fileRegex: \.(md|txt|rst)$ description: Documentation files only - command

guidelines.guideline: Use regex patterns to limit file editing scope
Consider the principle of least privilege

step.title: Create XML Instruction Files
step.description: Design structured instruction files in the appropriate location

global_mode.note: XML files go in repository root directory for global modes

project_mode.note: XML files go in .roo folder for project-specific modes

xml_best_practices.practice: Use semantic tag names that describe content
Nest tags hierarchically for better organization
Include code examples in CDATA sections when needed
Add comments to explain complex sections

step.title: Test and Refine
step.description: Verify the mode works as intended

checklist.item: Mode appears in the mode list
All examples are accurate and helpful

global_mode_commands.command: Create XML instruction files in rules-[mode-slug]/ (repository root)
Include "source: global" field in YAML configuration

project_mode_commands.command: No source field needed (defaults to project)

verification_commands.command: Use list_files to verify folder structure
Test file regex patterns with search_files
